Lab03

Finn Lindgren

Source: vignettes/Lab03.Rmd
Lab03.Rmd

Statistical computing MATH10093: Computer lab 3

In this lab session you will explore Monte Carlo integration methods. You will not hand in anything, but you should keep your code script file for later use.

  1. Go to your project clone of your lab 2 repository. During the lab, store new code in one or more new files and commit and push them to github, as in lab 2.
  2. Upgrade the StatCompLab package to version >= 0.3.0, with devtools::install_github("finnlindgren/StatCompLab", build_vignettes = TRUE) and restart you R session, via the RStudio Session menu.
  3. Open the Tutorial 03 tutorial in the Tutorial pane and work through the tasks. If you get the message “Connection refused” in rstudio.cloud, the reload your browser window and start the Tutorial 03 tutorial again.

When running the install_github() function, R/RStudio will often ask you if you want to upgrade other packages that it lists. This is usually what you need, and you can then enter the number of the option to upgrade all of them. If you’re unsure, you can instead choose the option to upgrade only the CRAN packages. CRAN is a centralised collection of R packages that have stronger stability than development versions from github, and unless you know you need a development version, you can usually stick with only CRAN packages. Notable exceptions are the StatCompLab package itself, and the gradethis package that is used by some of the documents in the StatCompLab package, but during the course you should only need to install gradethis once; we only use a specific development version of that package, and do not use the more recent development versions.
